alert.note: Alert for Washington (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 07 at 3:45PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Oregon and southwest Washington, including the following counties, in northwest Oregon, Clatsop, Columbia, Tillamook, Washington and Yamhill. In southwest Washington, Cowlitz, Pacific and Wahkiakum. * WHEN...Until 800 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 340 PM PST, Flooding is ongoing, but should continue to recede as the heaviest rain has ended. A number of roads remain closed due to high water across the area, but these should gradually open over the next several hours as water works its way through the river systems. - Low-lying and poor drainage areas, particularly near creeks and rivers. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
